name: F. Joker
input: InputThe first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains three integers $$$n$$$, $$$m$$$, and $$$q$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le 10^9$$$; $$$1 \le m \le n$$$; $$$1 \le q \le 2 \cdot 10^5$$$).The second line contains $$$q$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_q$$$ ($$$1 \le a_i \le n$$$).Additional constraint on the input: the sum of $$$q$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
output: OutputFor each test case, print $$$q$$$ integers — the number of distinct positions where the joker can be after each operation.
